body:
Currently, each player and section are separated. In order to group your content properly, you could do: ```
...

... ```

**<html> and </html> are missing.**

 Your code doesn't contain full structure of a HTML page. Even [some tags can be omitted](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5641997/is-it-necessary-to-write-head-body-and-html-tags), I would like you to implement your website completely as it is your very first web development foundation."


Consider the standard HTML structure as shown below when you develop a website.
```
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
   <head>
      <title>Page Title</title>
      <link rel="YOUR_CSS_FILE_PATH" type="text/css">
      <meta charset="UTF-8">
   </head>
   <body>

      YOUR CONTENT
      YOUR CONTENT

   </body>
</html>
```

**Just an idea**: An another way to display this content is to create a list element. By using a list element, readers can see and understand your note better. You can learn more at: http://www.w3schools.com/html/html_lists.asp

**This image needs a better text alternative. **

The `alt` attribute provides a text alternative to an image. It describes an image to those who can not see the image (e.g., slow connection, blind user) and also describes an image to the Search engine crawlers. So, it's a good idea to use the text that fulfills the same function as the image.

Please be consistent in writing style. 
- When quoting attribute values, use double quotation marks and remove trailing white spaces.  
- All code has to be lowercase. This applies to HTML element names, attributes, attribute values (unless text/CDATA). 

Check out the [Udacity Frontend Nanodegree Style Guide](https://udacity.github.io/frontend-nanodegree-styleguide/) to learn more! :smile:
